title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1104.1 - Certification and licensing by reciprocity
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1104.1 - Certification and licensing by reciprocity

State Regulations

An applicant may be certified or licensed in the State of New

York without examination and without further qualification if the applicant
provides proof, satisfactory to the Department of State: (a) that the applicant is certified or
licensed in another state or territory; and
(b) that the certification and licensing
requirements of that state or territory meet the following criteria: (1)
the state or territory's certification
and licensing program is in compliance with the provisions of Title XI of the

Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery and Enforcement Act of 1989; (2)
the state or territory's examination has
been approved by the Appraiser Qualification Board of the Appraisal Foundation; and
(3)
the state or territory has
licensing and certification qualification requirements that meet or exceed
those of New York State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
1104.1

Amended, New

York State Register December 31, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 52, eff. 1/1/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
